    • Uses of Agent in i5.las2peer.api

      Methods in i5.las2peer.api that return Agent 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Agent Context.fetchAgent(java.lang.String agentId)
      Fetches an agent from the network.
      Agent Context.getMainAgent()
      Get the main agent of this context.
      Agent Context.requestAgent(java.lang.String agentId)
      Requests an agent from the network using the calling (main) agent.
      Agent Context.requestAgent(java.lang.String agentId, Agent using)
      Fetches an agent from the network and trys to unlock it using the specified agent.
      Methods in i5.las2peer.api with parameters of type Agent 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Envelope Context.createEnvelope(java.lang.String identifier, Agent using)
      Creates a new envelope with the given agent as signing agent and first reader.
      GroupAgent Context.createGroupAgent(Agent[] members)
      Creates a new GroupAgent.
      boolean Context.hasAccess(java.lang.String agentId, Agent using)
      Checks if the agent specified by using is able to unlock the agent agentId.
      void Context.reclaimEnvelope(java.lang.String identifier, Agent using)
      Reclaims the envelope using the specified agent.
      Agent Context.requestAgent(java.lang.String agentId, Agent using)
      Fetches an agent from the network and trys to unlock it using the specified agent.
      Envelope Context.requestEnvelope(java.lang.String identifier, Agent using)
      Requests an envelope from the network.
      void Context.storeAgent(Agent agent)
      Stores and/or updates an agent to the network.
      void Context.storeEnvelope(Envelope env, Agent using)
      Stores the envelope to the network and signs it with the specified agent.
      void Context.storeEnvelope(Envelope env, EnvelopeCollisionHandler handler, Agent using)
      Stores the envelope to the network and signs it with the specified agent.

      Checks if the given agent is direct reader of this envelope.
      void Envelope.revokeReader(Agent agent)

      Subinterfaces of Agent in i5.las2peer.api.security 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  AnonymousAgent 
      interface  GroupAgent
      Represents a group of agents that is an agent itself.
      interface  PassphraseAgent
      Represents an agent that can be unlocked using a passphrase.
      interface  ServiceAgent
      Represents an agent responsible for executing a service on a node.
      interface  UserAgent
      An agent representing a user.
      Methods in i5.las2peer.api.security with parameters of type Agent 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void GroupAgent.addMember(Agent agent)
      Adds a member to the group.
      boolean GroupAgent.hasMember(Agent agent)
      Checks if the given agent is a member of this group.
      void GroupAgent.revokeMember(Agent agent)
      Revokes a group membership.
      void GroupAgent.unlock(Agent agent)
      Unlock this group using a given agent.

    • Uses of Agent in i5.las2peer.logging

      Methods in i5.las2peer.logging with parameters of type Agent 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void L2pLogger.logEvent(MonitoringEvent event, Agent actingUser, java.lang.String message)
      Deprecated. 
      Use Context.monitorEvent(Object, MonitoringEvent, String, boolean) Writes a log message. The given event can be used to differentiate between different log messages.
      static void L2pLogger.logEvent(Node node, java.lang.Object from, MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String message, Agent serviceAgent, Agent actingUser)
      Deprecated. 
      Use Context.monitorEvent(Object, MonitoringEvent, String, boolean) Writes a log message. The given event can be used to differentiate between different log messages. The serviceAgent and actingUser can be set to null if not known. Then this message will not be monitored by the monitoring observer.
      static void L2pLogger.logEvent(java.lang.Object from, MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String message, Agent serviceAgent, Agent actingUser)
      Deprecated. 
      Use Context.monitorEvent(Object, MonitoringEvent, String, boolean) Writes a log message. The given event can be used to differentiate between different log messages. The serviceAgent and actingUser can be set to null if not known. Then this message will not be monitored by the monitoring observer.

    • Uses of Agent in i5.las2peer.security

      Classes in i5.las2peer.security that implement Agent 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AgentImpl
      An Agent is the basic acting entity in the las2peer network.
      class  AnonymousAgentImpl 
      class  BotAgent 
      class  EthereumAgent
      User agent for las2peer networks with blockchain-based registry.
      class  GroupAgentImpl
      An agent representing a group of other agents.
      class  MonitoringAgent
      A MonitoringAgent is responsible for sending monitoring information collected at the MonitoringObserver.
      class  PassphraseAgentImpl
      Base class for pass phrase protected agents.
      class  ServiceAgentImpl
      A service agent represents a service and its access rights in the las2peer setting.
      class  UserAgentImpl
      An UserAgent represent a (End)user of the las2peer system.
